So how much harder do missions to Duna, Laythe, and Eve get with this aerodynamics update? I have to imagine that if re-entry heating around Duna is significant enough to destroy parts, then missions there are going to involve a lot more moving parts (kinda like the problems the Mars rovers faced).

Depends on how you slow down in the higher atmosphere. Those tiny chutes looked incredibly powerful, just as the airbrakes. Come in shallow and manage to lose enough speed in high atmosphere, and reentry shouldn't pose much of a problem. Targeting specific landing sites could get a bit harder, though.
What I'd like is an actual reason to drogue chutes.

What I'd like is an actual reason to drogue chutes.

You may have your reason. They looked extremely effective the one time I saw them used. They weren't strictly necessary there but I could see a situation (ie, more than just the mk1 command pod coming down) where they could be quite useful.

What really makes me wonder is why all the streamers up until now have so great problems with spaceplanes and overheating on launch (to say nothing about reentry). In FAR+ Deadly Reentry it was a distinct learning curve to handle the heat with the right launch / reentry angle, speed and such plus some new lessons about building spaceplanes. But from what i have seen in 1.0 it seems that the cockpits and wings dont show any heatshielding at all. Is this correct? Or is it simply the problem of these people transitioning from the soup to some kind of legit athmosphere?

Seemed like maybe out of habit or something and not being used to the new aero.

ShimmytheJJ plays with DRE and FAR, so maybe we'll see how he (or she, if thats the case) does?
